page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT
page.content: EMPLOYMENT The area has no unemployment problem. Most people who wish to work have jobs although not always in the village itself. Those who are employed in the area usually work on farms. There is also a public house. There is a public stud for National Hunt horses and a farm attached which produces beef cattle, corn and barley. Help with harvesting produces the need for extra labour. Other jobs include a farm bailiff, a game keeper,domestic work and a thriving base for tourism at a local farm run by the owner and his family. This involves the provision of accommodation for visitors to the area. There are also resident within the area members of The Royal Airforce from the Helicopter and Air Traffic Control base at nearby Shawbury.
